title: Epic (2015)
description: I added new annotation functionality to Haiku Android, Epic's mobile application for physicians, and I collaborated with two other interns to deliver cross-platform compatibility to Haiku on both iOS and Android.
bullets: Developed an Android activity that allows physicians to create text and drawing annotations on images
Utilized OpenCV for image processing to allow for distance annotations given a reference object
Designed annotations to support cross-platform compatibility with iOS devices

title: Swanson School of Engineering (2015)
description: Quantifying the effects of radiation heat transfer in thermoelectric devices (TEDs) sheds light on the affects of different interconnect geometries on efficiency.  I worked with MEMS instructor Matthew Barry to develop a program for determining the effects of radiation heat transfer in different TED structures
bullets: Created a ray tracer to simulate heat radiation in thermoelectric devices
Utilized GPU acceleration to improve drastically the simulation’s speed and precision
Developed a web interface for remotely managing simulations using Java’s HttpServer and Bootstrap
Second author of Energy journal article "Numerical Solution of Radiation View Factors within a Thermoelectric Device" (under review)

title: Epic (2014)
description: I ported a Visual Basic Hyperspace activity to Hyperspace Web, which involved creating a responsive web application compatible with all modern browsers, streamlining the UI, and adding new features.
bullets: Produced a secure, responsive ASP.NET web application
Accessed Caché database in C# using proprietary ORM to store and retrieve relevant data
Collaborated with user experience and quality assurance staff to design and implement a scalable user interface

title: Tab Cleaner (2015)
description: I developed a Chrome extension to clean up Chrome's new tab page.  Actively communicating with users and implementing their suggestions continues to be very rewarding.  Check out my Github page for the source code!
bullets: Published a Chrome extension that allows for the customization and simplification of Chrome's new tab page
Adhered to material design principles and actively interacted with users to improve usability

title: Bentley Systems (2013)
description: I modified MicroStation source code to use C++11's enum classes and refactored legacy code.
bullets: Modified MicroStation source to comply with C++11 standards using Python and regular expressions
Refactored legacy code to improve maintainability
